alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 07 at 1:39PM PST until November 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In California, eastern portions of Modoc County, including the Warners and portions of Hwy 395 and 299. In Oregon, the higher terrain of eastern Klamath County and western Lake County including the Winter Rim. This also affects some lower elevations including portions of Hwy 31, 395 and 140, and the communities of Paisley, Summer Lake, Lakeview, and Valley Falls. * WHEN...From 4 PM Tuesday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
